summary: Masjid al-Haram, or the Sacred Mosque, is Islam's most important mosque, located in Mecca, Saudi Arabia. It surrounds the Kaaba, a sacred site for Muslims. Pilgrims from around the world visit for the Hajj and Ê¿Umrah pilgrimages, where they walk around the Kaaba. The mosque features significant landmarks like the Black Stone and Zamzam Well. It is the largest and most expensive mosque globally, with a rich history of expansions and renovations. It is currently overseen by the King of Saudi Arabia.
title: Masjid al-Haram
